thread.title: From Hollyoaks to Hollywood: Alfie and Tabby leave in a limo as he says goodbye to Jade
thread.title_full: From Hollyoaks to Hollywood: Alfie and Tabby leave in a limo as he says goodbye to Jade

author: Alistair McGeorge
title: From Hollyoaks to Hollywood: Alfie and Tabby leave in a limo as he says goodbye to Jade
text:
Get soaps   Thank you for subscribing!   
There were emotional scenes in Hollyoaks on Monday evening as Alfie was finally able to say goodbye and let Jade go after her death. 
In the months after his passing, he has been imagining that she was still around, but a heart to heart with glamorous grandmother Tabby has helped him start to move on. 
Tabby Maxwell-Brown - played by Linda Grey - was back on the soap this week for her grandson Nathan's funeral , but it was Alfie (Richard Linnell) who needed support. Alfie has finally said goodbye to Jade's memory (Photo: Channel 4) Tabby convinced him to take a break in Hollywood (Photo: Channel 4) 
He's been struggling to deal with the grief of losing both Jade and Nathan - but she's made him realise it's time to let her go. 
She also even tried her first fish and chips, with the condition that Alfie would come to Los Angeles with her for a holiday. 
In Kassius Nelson's final scene on Hollyoaks, he said an emotional goodbye to his memory of Jade on Monday's episode. He's going to get some time away (Photo: Channel 4) 
He couldn't hide his reaction when Tabby pulled up in a white stretch limo to take him from the village. 
They were certainly going to "travel in style" - and he'll be back on screen next month after his holiday. Like us on Facebook
